asteroids.part2.facade

Interface IFacade

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IFacade
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IFacade

    public interface IFacade
extends IFacade
    Implement this interface to connect your code to the graphical user interface (GUI).
    • For separating the code that you wrote from the code that was provided to you, put ALL your code in the src folder. The code that is provided to you stays in the src-provided folder. Only if you modify the provided code, it's advised to move the modified code to the src folder, so that your changes cannot be accidentally overwritten by an updated version of the provided code.
    • You should at least create the following classes in the package asteroids.model:
      • a class Ship for representing a space ship
      • a class World for representing a world
      • a class Bullet for representing a bullet
      You may, of course, add additional classes as you see fit.
    • You should change your Facade from part 1 to implement this interface.
    • The header of that Facade class should look as follows:
      class Facade implements asteroids.part2.facade.IFacade { ... }
      Consult the Java tutorial for more information on interfaces, if necessary.
    • Your Facade class should offer a default constructor.
    • Each non-deprecated method defined in this IFacade interface and the interface from part 1 ( IFacade) must be implemented by your Facade class.
    • The methods createShip(), createShip(double, double, double, double, double, double), move(Ship, double) and thrust(Ship, double) from part 1 are deprecated and no longer need to be implemented.
    • Methods in this interface are only allowed to throw exceptions of type asteroids.util.ModelException (this class is provided). No other exception types are allowed. This exception can only be thrown if (1) calling a method of your Ship class with the given parameters would violate a precondition, or (2) if the method of your Ship class throws an exception (if so, wrap the exception in a ModelException).
    • ModelException should not be used anywhere outside of your Facade implementation.
    • Your Facade implementation should only contain trivial code (for example, calling a method, combining multiple return values into an array, creating @Value instances, catching exceptions and wrapping it in a ModelException). All non-trivial code should be placed in the other classes that you create.
    • The rules described above and the documentation described below for each method apply only to the class implementing IFacade. Your other classes should follow the rules described in the assignment.
    • Do not modify the signatures of the methods defined in this interface.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBulletToWorld(World world, Bullet bullet)
      Add bullet to world.

      Bullet createBullet(double x, double y, double xVelocity, double yVelocity, double radius)
      Create a new non-null bullet with the given position, velocity and radius, The bullet is not located in a world nor loaded on a ship.
      default Ship createShip()
      Deprecated. 
      Since part 2 of the project. The method description (unit circle) was inconsistent with the constraints described in the assignment (minimum radius).
      default Ship createShip(double x, double y, double xVelocity, double yVelocity, double radius, double angle)
      Deprecated. 
      Since part 2 of the project. This behavior is now triggered through the createShip(double, double, double, double, double, double, double) method (which includes the mass as an additional parameter).

                double direction,

         throws ModelException
        Create a new non-null ship with the given position, velocity, radius, direction and mass. The thruster of the new ship is initially inactive. The ship is not located in a world.

      • getTimeNextCollision

        double getTimeNextCollision(World world)
                     throws ModelException
        Return the time that must pass before a boundary collision or an entity collision will take place in the given world. Positive Infinity is returned if no collision will occur.
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • getPositionNextCollision

        double[] getPositionNextCollision(World world)
                           throws ModelException
        Return the position of the first boundary collision or entity collision that will take place in the given world. Null is returned if no collision will occur.
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • evolve

        void evolve(World world,
            double dt,
            CollisionListener collisionListener)
     throws ModelException
        Advance world by dt seconds. To enable explosions within the UI, notify collisionListener whenever an entity collides with a boundary or another entity during this method. collisionListener may be null. If collisionListener is null, do not call its notify methods.
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • getEntityAt

        java.lang.Object getEntityAt(World world,

                             double y)
                      throws ModelException
        Return the entity at the given position in the given world.
        Throws:
        ModelException

      • thrust

        @Deprecated
default void thrust(Ship ship,
                                 double amount)
                          throws ModelException
        Deprecated. Since part 2 of the project. This behavior is now triggered through the combination of setThrusterActive(Ship, boolean) and evolve(World, double, CollisionListener) methods.
        This method is deprecated; you should not implement nor use it.
        Specified by:
        thrust in interface IFacade
        Throws:
